topics.body:
Okay. I just had a thought.
Days of Future Past spoilers ahead.
[spoiler]Remember how that movie stated that JFK was a mutant? If that's the case what would his mutant ability be, and how did a mutant even get elected if people have such a hate-boner for them?[/spoiler]
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/546ab7bd63687210ca450100#post_546ab7bd63687210ca450100
Maybe it was just his weird derp eyes.
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/546ab7bd63687210ca450100#post_546ab7bd63687210ca450100
clearly he had a power that he could actually control, and wasn't obvious to the average person
topics.author: 4fe3df367f123b517900066a

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/546ab7bd63687210ca450100#post_546ab7bd63687210ca450100

[spoiler]His abilities were his white teeth and charisma. That's why people elected him.

But in all seriousness, maybe it was something akin to Mystique, in that he could alter not his appereance, but how other people percieved him. Like, he would have a different aspect when people saw him.[/spoiler]
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/546ab88b63687214292a0100#post_546ab88b63687214292a0100
That...actually sounds like a cool ability.
And abusable as all hell.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/546ab8c36368721784840100#post_546ab8c36368721784840100

[spoiler]Not as much. Because how you look is dependant on how people _percieve you_. It's social pressure to the Nth degree, because it's the opinion of others what dictates how you look. Think about it.

In the case of Kennedy, he acted like a charismatic, nicest person you'll ever meet, and that's how people percieved him. Now, think on how his oppossision saw him.[/spoiler]
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4
